001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui;
002
003import squidpony.squidgrid.gui.Colors;
004import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
005
006import javax.swing.JLayeredPane;
007import java.awt.Color;
008import java.awt.Font;
009import java.awt.Graphics;
010import java.awt.Toolkit;
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.List;
013
014/**
015 * A helper class to make using multiple SquidPanels easier.
016 * There is some useful documentation in this class' getPalette method (honestly, I don't know where else to put
017 * documentation specifically about this class' default palette).
018 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 7/6/2015.
019 */
020@Beta
021public class SquidLayers extends JLayeredPane {
022    protected int width;
023    protected int height;
024    protected int cellWidth;
025    protected int cellHeight;
026    protected SquidPanel backgroundPanel, lightnessPanel, foregroundPanel;
027    protected int[][] bgIndices;
028    protected int[][] lightnesses;
029    protected ArrayList<SquidPanel> extraPanels;
030    protected TextCellFactory textFactory;
031    protected ArrayList<Color> palette, lightingPalette;
032    protected boolean[][] values;
033
034    /**
035     * The pixel width of the entire map.
036     * @return
037     */
038    @Override
039    public int getWidth() {
040        return width * cellWidth;
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * The pixel height of the entire map.
045     * @return
046     */
047    @Override
048    public int getHeight() {
049        return height * cellHeight;
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Width of the map in grid cells.
054     * @return
055     */
056    public int getGridWidth() {
057        return width;
058    }
059
060    /**
061     * Height of the map in grid cells.
062     * @return
063     */
064    public int getGridHeight() {
065        return height;
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Width of one cell in pixels.
070     * @return
071     */
072    public int getCellWidth() {
073        return cellWidth;
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * Height of one cell in pixels.
078     * @return
079     */
080    public int getCellHeight() {
081        return cellHeight;
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Gets the current palette used when no other is specified.
086     *
087     * The palette can be customized with SquidLayers.alterPalette() and SquidLayers.extendPalette() .
088     *
089     * The default palette has colors at these elements:
090     * <ul>
091     *     <li>0: Black, also used for backgrounds if not specified</li>
092     *     <li>1: Off-white, used as the default foreground at times</li>
093     *     <li>2: Dark gray for walls</li>
094     *     <li>3: Silver gray for floors</li>
095     *     <li>4: Rust brown for doors</li>
096     *     <li>5: Gray-blue for water</li>
097     *     <li>6: Bright orange for traps</li>
098     *     <li>7: White</li>
099     *     <li>8: Light gray</li>
100     *     <li>9: Dark gray</li>
101     *     <li>10: Light red</li>
102     *     <li>11: Medium red</li>
103     *     <li>12: Dark red</li>
104     *     <li>13: Light orange</li>
105     *     <li>14: Medium orange</li>
106     *     <li>15: Dark orange</li>
107     *     <li>16: Light yellow</li>
108     *     <li>17: Medium yellow</li>
109     *     <li>18: Dark yellow</li>
110     *     <li>19: Light green</li>
111     *     <li>20: Medium green</li>
112     *     <li>21: Dark green</li>
113     *     <li>22: Light blue-green</li>
114     *     <li>23: Medium blue-green</li>
115     *     <li>24: Dark blue-green</li>
116     *     <li>25: Light blue</li>
117     *     <li>26: Medium blue</li>
118     *     <li>27: Dark blue</li>
119     *     <li>28: Light purple</li>
120     *     <li>29: Medium purple</li>
121     *     <li>30: Dark purple</li>
122     *     <li>31: Light pink</li>
123     *     <li>32: Medium pink</li>
124     *     <li>33: Dark pink</li>
125     *     <li>34: Light gray-brown</li>
126     *     <li>35: Medium gray-brown</li>
127     *     <li>36: Dark gray-brown</li>
128     *     <li>37: Light brown</li>
129     *     <li>38: Medium brown</li>
130     *     <li>39: Dark brown</li>
131     * </ul>
132     * @return the current Color ArrayList used as a default palette.
133     */
134    public ArrayList<Color> getPalette() {
135        return palette;
136    }
137
138    /**
139     * Get the lightness modifiers used for background cells as an int[][], with elements between 0 and 511, 256 as the
140     * unmodified lightness level, lower numbers meaning darker, and higher meaning lighter.
141     * @return
142     */
143    public int[][] getLightnesses() {
144        return lightnesses;
145    }
146
147    /**
148     * Get all the background color indices at once, which are probably indexed into the default palette. See the
149     * documentation for the getPalette() method in this class for more information.
150     * @return
151     */
152    public int[][] getBgIndices() {
153        return bgIndices;
154    }
155
156    /**
157     * Sets the lightness modifiers used for background cells with the int[][] passed as lightnesses. This 2D array
158     * should have elements between 0 to 511, with 256 as the unmodified lightness level, lower numbers meaning darker,
159     * and higher meaning lighter. Elements less than 0 or higher than 511 will probably cause array out-of-bounds
160     * exceptions to be thrown when this renders, so just don't do that. This doesn't validate because maps can get
161     * large, validating many cells could be expensive, and this might be called often if it's being called at all.
162     * @param lightnesses 2D array, width and height should match this class' gridWidth and gridHeight. elements must
163     *                    be between 0 and 511.
164     */
165    public void setLightnesses(int[][] lightnesses) {
166        this.lightnesses = lightnesses;
167    }
168
169    /**
170     * Set all of the background colors at once, using indexes into what is probably the default palette unless
171     * otherwise specified in the call to put(). If you want subtle variations on a color, don't add a new entry to
172     * the default palette every time if you can set the lightness differently for things with that color. Indices
173     * should correspond to the numbers in getPalette()'s documentation, or higher if you extended it.
174     * @param bgIndices 2D array, width and height should match this class' gridWidth and gridHeight.
175     */
176    public void setBgIndices(int[][] bgIndices) {
177        this.bgIndices = bgIndices;
178    }
179
180    /**
181     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the default <b>square</b> font, 40 cells wide and high, with a size of
182     * 12x12 pixels for each cell.
183     */
184    public SquidLayers()
185    {
186        this(40, 40);
187    }
188
189    /**
190     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the default <b>square</b> font, the given number of cells for gridWidth
191     * and gridHeight, and 12x12 pixels for each cell.
192     * @param gridWidth in grid cells
193     * @param gridHeight in grid cells
194     */
195    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight)
196    {
197        super();
198        initPalettes();
199        width = gridWidth;
200        height = gridHeight;
201
202        cellWidth = 12;
203        cellHeight = 12;
204
205        bgIndices = new int[width][height];
206        lightnesses = new int[width][height];
207        values = new boolean[width][height];
208
209        for(int x = 0; x < width; x++)
210        {
211            for(int y = 0; y < height; y++)
212            {
213                lightnesses[x][y] = 256;
214            }
215        }
216
217        textFactory = new TextCellFactory().font(DefaultResources.getDefaultFont()).width(12).height(12).initBySize();
218
219        backgroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight);
220        backgroundPanel.setOpaque(true);
221        lightnessPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight);
222        lightnessPanel.setOpaque(false);
223        foregroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight);
224        foregroundPanel.setOpaque(false);
225
226        backgroundPanel.refresh();
227        lightnessPanel.refresh();
228        foregroundPanel.refresh();
229
230        extraPanels = new ArrayList<SquidPanel>();
231
232        this.setLayer(backgroundPanel, 0);
233        this.add(backgroundPanel);
234        this.setLayer(lightnessPanel, 1);
235        this.add(lightnessPanel);
236        this.setLayer(foregroundPanel, 2);
237        this.add(foregroundPanel);
238
239        this.setSize(backgroundPanel.getPreferredSize());
240        this.setPreferredSize(backgroundPanel.getPreferredSize());
241    }
242
243    /**
244     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the default <b>narrow</b> font, the given number of cells for gridWidth
245     * and gridHeight, and the size in pixels for each cell given by cellWidth and cellHeight.
246     * @param gridWidth in grid cells
247     * @param gridHeight in grid cells
248     * @param cellWidth in pixels
249     * @param cellHeight in pixels
250     */
251    public  SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight)
252    {
253        super();
254        initPalettes();
255        width = gridWidth;
256        height = gridHeight;
257
258        this.cellWidth = cellWidth;
259        this.cellHeight = cellHeight;
260
261        bgIndices = new int[width][height];
262        lightnesses = new int[width][height];
263        values = new boolean[width][height];
264        for(int x = 0; x < width; x++)
265        {
266            for(int y = 0; y < height; y++)
267            {
268                lightnesses[x][y] = 256;
269            }
270        }
271
272        textFactory = new TextCellFactory().font(DefaultResources
273                .getDefaultNarrowFont().deriveFont(4.0f * gridHeight / 3.0f))
274                .width(cellWidth).height(cellHeight).initBySize();
275
276        backgroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory, null);
277        backgroundPanel.setOpaque(true);
278        lightnessPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory, null);
279        lightnessPanel.setOpaque(false);
280        foregroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory, null);
281        foregroundPanel.setOpaque(false);
282
283        backgroundPanel.refresh();
284        lightnessPanel.refresh();
285        foregroundPanel.refresh();
286
287        extraPanels = new ArrayList<SquidPanel>();
288
289        this.setLayer(backgroundPanel, 0);
290        this.add(backgroundPanel);
291        this.setLayer(lightnessPanel, 1);
292        this.add(lightnessPanel);
293        this.setLayer(foregroundPanel, 2);
294        this.add(foregroundPanel);
295
296        this.setSize(backgroundPanel.getPreferredSize());
297        this.setPreferredSize(backgroundPanel.getPreferredSize());
298    }
299
300    /**
301     * Create a new SquidLayers widget with the given Font, the given number of cells for gridWidth
302     * and gridHeight, and the size in pixels for each cell given by cellWidth and cellHeight.
303     * @param gridWidth in grid cells
304     * @param gridHeight in grid cells
305     * @param cellWidth in pixels
306     * @param cellHeight in pixels
307     * @param font A Font that should have been assigned a size before being passed here.
308     */
309    public SquidLayers(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight, Font font)
310    {
311        super();
312        initPalettes();
313
314        width = gridWidth;
315        height = gridHeight;
316
317        this.cellWidth = cellWidth;
318        this.cellHeight = cellHeight;
319
320        bgIndices = new int[width][height];
321        lightnesses = new int[width][height];
322        values = new boolean[width][height];
323        for(int x = 0; x < width; x++)
324        {
325            for(int y = 0; y < height; y++)
326            {
327                lightnesses[x][y] = 256;
328            }
329        }
330
331        textFactory = new TextCellFactory().font(font).width(cellWidth).height(cellHeight).initVerbatim();
332
333        backgroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory, null);
334        backgroundPanel.setOpaque(true);
335        lightnessPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory, null);
336        lightnessPanel.setOpaque(false);
337        foregroundPanel = new SquidPanel(gridWidth, gridHeight, textFactory, null);
338        foregroundPanel.setOpaque(false);
339
340        backgroundPanel.refresh();
341        lightnessPanel.refresh();
342        foregroundPanel.refresh();
343
344        extraPanels = new ArrayList<SquidPanel>();
345
346        this.setLayer(backgroundPanel, 0);
347        this.add(backgroundPanel);
348        this.setLayer(lightnessPanel, 1);
349        this.add(lightnessPanel);
350        this.setLayer(foregroundPanel, 2);
351        this.add(foregroundPanel);
352
353        this.setSize(backgroundPanel.getPreferredSize());
354        this.setPreferredSize(backgroundPanel.getPreferredSize());
355    }
356
357    private void initPalettes()
358    {
359        palette = new ArrayList<Color>(256);
360        palette.add(Colors.DARK_SLATE_GRAY);
361        palette.add(Colors.CREAM);
362        palette.add(Colors.FLATTERY_BROWN);
363        palette.add(Colors.SILVER_GREY);
364        palette.add(Colors.RUST);
365        palette.add(Colors.WATER);
366        palette.add(Colors.INTERNATIONAL_ORANGE);
367
368        palette.add(Colors.WHITE);
369        palette.add(Colors.LIGHT_GRAY);
370        palette.add(Colors.DARK_GRAY);
371
372        palette.add(Colors.RED_INCENSE);
373        palette.add(Colors.RED);
374        palette.add(Colors.COCHINEAL_RED);
375
376        palette.add(Colors.PEACH_ORANGE);
377        palette.add(Colors.ORANGE_PEEL);
378        palette.add(Colors.TANGERINE);
379
380        palette.add(Colors.LEMON_CHIFFON);
381        palette.add(Colors.CORN);
382        palette.add(Colors.GOLDEN_YELLOW);
383
384        palette.add(Colors.TEA_GREEN);
385        palette.add(Colors.LIME_GREEN);
386        palette.add(Colors.PINE_GREEN);
387
388        palette.add(Colors.BABY_BLUE);
389        palette.add(Colors.CYAN);
390        palette.add(Colors.BLUE_GREEN);
391
392        palette.add(Colors.COLUMBIA_BLUE);
393        palette.add(Colors.ROYAL_BLUE);
394        palette.add(Colors.PERSIAN_BLUE);
395
396        palette.add(Colors.LAVENDER_BLUE);
397        palette.add(Colors.THIN_VIOLET);
398        palette.add(Colors.DARK_VIOLET);
399
400        palette.add(Colors.CARNATION_PINK);
401        palette.add(Colors.HOT_MAGENTA);
402        palette.add(Colors.LIGHT_MAROON);
403
404        palette.add(Colors.TAN);
405        palette.add(Colors.DARK_TAN);
406        palette.add(Colors.PALE_BROWN);
407
408        palette.add(Colors.STEAMED_CHESTNUT);
409        palette.add(Colors.DARK_CHESTNUT);
410        palette.add(Colors.SAPPANWOOD_INCENSE);
411
412        lightingPalette = new ArrayList<Color>(512);
413        for(int i = 0; i < 512; i++)
414        {
415            lightingPalette.add(Colors.TRANSPARENT);
416        }
417        for(int i = 1; i < 256; i++)
418        {
419            lightingPalette.set(256 + i, new Color(0xFF, 0xFD, 0xD8, i));
420            lightingPalette.set(256 - i, new Color(0, 0, 0, i));
421        }
422
423    }
424
425    /**
426     * Add an extra layer on top of the foreground layer. Use putInto methods to specify the layer when adding a char (0
427     * is background, 1 is lightness modifiers, 2 is foreground, and the first call to this method creates layer 3).
428     * @return
429     */
430    public SquidLayers addExtraLayer()
431    {
432        SquidPanel sp = new SquidPanel(width, height, textFactory, null);
433        this.setLayer(sp, 3 + extraPanels.size());
434        sp.refresh();
435        extraPanels.add(sp);
436        return this;
437    }
438
439    /**
440     * Adds a color to the end of the default palette, then returns that palette.
441     *
442     * The default palette's entries can be seen in the documentation for SquidLayers.getPalette() .
443     *
444     * @param color
445     * @return
446     */
447    public ArrayList<Color> extendPalette(Color color)
448    {
449        palette.add(color);
450        return palette;
451    }
452
453    /**
454     * Changes a color at the specified index in the default palette, then returns that palette.
455     *
456     * If the index is greater than or equal to the number of colors in the palette, does nothing.
457     *
458     * The default palette's entries can be seen in the documentation for SquidLayers.getPalette() .
459     *
460     * @param index must be at least 0 and less than the length of palette (starts at length 40).
461     * @param color
462     * @return
463     */
464    public ArrayList<Color> alterPalette(int index, Color color)
465    {
466        if(index >= 0 && index < palette.size())
467            palette.set(index, color);
468
469        return palette;
470    }
471
472    /**
473     * Place a char c into the foreground at position x, y, with the default color.
474     * @param x in grid cells.
475     * @param y in grid cells.
476     * @param c a character to be drawn in the foreground
477     */
478    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c)
479    {
480        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c);
481        values[x][y] = true;
482        return this;
483    }
484
485    /**
486     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into the default palette.
487     * @param x in grid cells.
488     * @param y in grid cells.
489     * @param c a character to be drawn in the foreground
490     * @param foregroundIndex int index into the default palette for the char being drawn
491     */
492    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, int foregroundIndex)
493    {
494        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, palette);
495        values[x][y] = true;
496        return this;
497    }
498
499    /**
500     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into the default palette, and a
501     * background color specified in the same way.
502     * @param x in grid cells.
503     * @param y in grid cells.
504     * @param c a character to be drawn in the foreground
505     * @param foregroundIndex int index into the default palette for the char being drawn
506     * @param backgroundIndex int index into the default palette for the background
507     */
508    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, int foregroundIndex, int backgroundIndex)
509    {
510        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, palette);
511        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, palette);
512        values[x][y] = true;
513        return this;
514    }
515
516    /**
517     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into the default palette, a
518     * background color specified in the same way, and a lightness variation for the background (0 is no change, 100 is
519     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
520     * @param x in grid cells.
521     * @param y in grid cells.
522     * @param c a character to be drawn in the foreground
523     * @param foregroundIndex int index into the default palette for the char being drawn
524     * @param backgroundIndex int index into the default palette for the background
525     * @param backgroundLightness int between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are darker, higher lighter.
526     */
527    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, int foregroundIndex, int backgroundIndex, int backgroundLightness)
528    {
529        backgroundLightness = clamp(backgroundLightness, -255, 255);
530        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, palette);
531        values[x][y] = true;
532        lightnesses[x][y] = 256 + backgroundLightness;
533
534        lightnessPanel.put(x, y, 256 + backgroundLightness, lightingPalette);
535        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, palette);
536        return this;
537    }
538
539    /**
540     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into alternatePalette, a
541     * background color specified in the same way, and a lightness variation for the background (0 is no change, 100 is
542     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
543     * @param x in grid cells.
544     * @param y in grid cells.
545     * @param c a character to be drawn in the foreground
546     * @param alternatePalette an alternate Color List for both foreground and background
547     * @param foregroundIndex int index into alternatePalette for the char being drawn
548     * @param backgroundIndex int index into alternatePalette for the background
549     * @param backgroundLightness int between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are darker, higher lighter.
550     */
551    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, List<Color> alternatePalette, int foregroundIndex, int backgroundIndex, int backgroundLightness)
552    {
553        backgroundLightness = clamp(backgroundLightness, -255, 255);
554        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, alternatePalette);
555        values[x][y] = true;
556        lightnesses[x][y] = 256 + backgroundLightness;
557
558        lightnessPanel.put(x, y, 256 + backgroundLightness, lightingPalette);
559        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, alternatePalette);
560        return this;
561    }
562    /**
563     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into alternatePalette, a
564     * background color specified in the same way, and a lightness variation for the background (0 is no change, 100 is
565     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
566     * @param x in grid cells.
567     * @param y in grid cells.
568     * @param c a character to be drawn in the foreground
569     * @param foregroundIndex int index into alternatePalette for the char being drawn
570     * @param fgPalette an alternate Color List for the foreground; can be null to use the default.
571     * @param backgroundIndex int index into alternatePalette for the background
572     * @param bgPalette an alternate Color List for the background; can be null to use the default.
573     * @param backgroundLightness int between -255 and 255 , lower numbers are darker, higher lighter.
574     */
575    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c, int foregroundIndex, List<Color> fgPalette, int backgroundIndex, List<Color> bgPalette, int backgroundLightness)
576    {
577        backgroundLightness = clamp(backgroundLightness, -255, 255);
578        if(fgPalette == null) fgPalette = palette;
579        if(bgPalette == null) bgPalette = palette;
580        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, fgPalette);
581        values[x][y] = true;
582        lightnesses[x][y] = 256 + backgroundLightness;
583
584        lightnessPanel.put(x, y, 256 + backgroundLightness, lightingPalette);
585        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, bgPalette);
586        return this;
587    }
588
589
590    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char[][] c)
591    {
592        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c);
593        for(int i = x; i < c.length && i < width; i++)
594        {
595            for(int j = y; j < c[i].length && j < height; j++)
596            {
597                values[i][j] = true;
598            }
599        }
600        return this;
601    }
602
603    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char[][] c, int[][] foregroundIndex)
604    {
605        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, palette);
606        for(int i = x; i < c.length && i < width; i++)
607        {
608            for(int j = y; j < c[i].length && j < height; j++)
609            {
610                values[i][j] = true;
611            }
612        }
613        return this;
614    }
615
616    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char c[][], int[][] foregroundIndex, int[][] backgroundIndex)
617    {
618        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, palette);
619        for(int i = x; i < c.length && i < width; i++)
620        {
621            for(int j = y; j < c[i].length && j < height; j++)
622            {
623                values[i][j] = true;
624            }
625        }
626        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, palette);
627        return this;
628    }
629
630    /**
631     * Place a char[][] c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into alternatePalette, a
632     * background color specified in the same way, and a lightness variation for the background (0 is no change, 100 is
633     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
634     * @param x in grid cells.
635     * @param y in grid cells.
636     * @param c char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
637     * @param foregroundIndex int[][] of indices into the default palette for the char being drawn
638     * @param backgroundIndex int[][] of indices into the default palette for the background
639     * @param backgroundLightness int[][] with elements between -255 and 255 , lower darker, higher lighter.
640     */
641    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char[][] c, int[][] foregroundIndex, int[][] backgroundIndex, int[][] backgroundLightness)
642    {
643        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, palette);
644        for(int i = x; i < width && i < backgroundLightness.length; i++) {
645            for (int j = y; j < height && j < backgroundLightness[i].length; j++)
646            {
647                lightnesses[i][j] = 256 + clamp(backgroundLightness[i][j], -255, 255);
648                values[i][j] = true;
649            }
650        }
651        lightnessPanel.put(0, 0, lightnesses, lightingPalette);
652        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, palette);
653        return this;
654    }
655
656    /**
657     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into alternatePalette, a
658     * background color specified in the same way, and a lightness variation for the background (0 is no change, 100 is
659     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
660     * @param x in grid cells.
661     * @param y in grid cells.
662     * @param c char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
663     * @param alternatePalette an alternate Color List for both foreground and background
664     * @param foregroundIndex int[][] of indices into alternatePalette for the char being drawn
665     * @param backgroundIndex int[][] of indices into alternatePalette for the background
666     * @param backgroundLightness int[][] with elements between -255 and 255 , lower darker, higher lighter.
667     */
668    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char[][] c, List<Color> alternatePalette,  int[][] foregroundIndex, int[][] backgroundIndex, int[][] backgroundLightness)
669    {
670
671        if(alternatePalette == null) alternatePalette = palette;
672        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, alternatePalette);
673        for(int i = x; i < width && i < backgroundLightness.length; i++) {
674            for (int j = y; j < height && j < backgroundLightness[i].length; j++)
675            {
676                lightnesses[i][j] = 256 + clamp(backgroundLightness[i][j], -255, 255);
677                values[i][j] = true;
678            }
679        }
680        lightnessPanel.put(0, 0, lightnesses, lightingPalette);
681        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, alternatePalette);
682        return this;
683    }
684    /**
685     * Place a char c into the foreground, with a foreground color specified by an index into alternatePalette, a
686     * background color specified in the same way, and a lightness variation for the background (0 is no change, 100 is
687     * very bright, -100 is very dark, anything past -150 or 150 will make the background almost fully black or white).
688     * @param x in grid cells.
689     * @param y in grid cells.
690     * @param c char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
691     * @param foregroundIndex int[][] of indices into fgPalette for the char being drawn
692     * @param fgPalette an alternate Color List for the foreground; can be null to use the default.
693     * @param backgroundIndex int[][] of indices into bgPalette for the background
694     * @param bgPalette an alternate Color List for the background; can be null to use the default.
695     * @param backgroundLightness int[][] with elements between -255 and 255 , lower darker, higher lighter.
696     */
697    public SquidLayers put(int x, int y, char[][] c, int[][] foregroundIndex, List<Color> fgPalette, int[][] backgroundIndex, List<Color> bgPalette, int[][] backgroundLightness)
698    {
699        if(fgPalette == null) fgPalette = palette;
700        if(bgPalette == null) bgPalette = palette;
701        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, c, foregroundIndex, fgPalette);
702        for(int i = x; i < width && i < backgroundLightness.length; i++) {
703            for (int j = y; j < height && j < backgroundLightness[i].length; j++)
704            {
705                lightnesses[i][j] =  256 +clamp(backgroundLightness[i][j], -255, 255);
706                values[i][j] = true;
707            }
708        }
709        lightnessPanel.put(0, 0, lightnesses, lightingPalette);
710        backgroundPanel.put(x, y, backgroundIndex, bgPalette);
711        return this;
712    }
713
714    /**
715     * Place a char c[][] into the specified layer, with a color specified by an index into alternatePalette.
716     * @param layer 0 for background, 1 for lightness, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
717     * @param x in grid cells.
718     * @param y in grid cells.
719     * @param c char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
720     */
721    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char c)
722    {
723        SquidPanel p = backgroundPanel;
724        switch (layer)
725        {
726            case 0: break;
727            case 1: p = lightnessPanel;
728                break;
729            case 2: p = foregroundPanel;
730                break;
731            default: p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
732        }
733        p.put(x, y, c);
734        values[x][y] = true;
735        return this;
736    }
737
738    /**
739     * Place a char c[][] into the specified layer, with a color specified by an index into the default palette.
740     * @param layer 0 for background, 1 for lightness, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
741     * @param x in grid cells.
742     * @param y in grid cells.
743     * @param c char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
744     * @param colorIndex int[][] of indices into alternatePalette for the char being drawn
745     */
746    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char c,  int colorIndex)
747    {
748        SquidPanel p = backgroundPanel;
749        switch (layer)
750        {
751            case 0: break;
752            case 1: p = lightnessPanel;
753                break;
754            case 2: p = foregroundPanel;
755                break;
756            default: p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
757        }
758        p.put(x, y, c, colorIndex, palette);
759        values[x][y] = true;
760        return this;
761    }
762
763    /**
764     * Place a char c[][] into the specified layer, with a color specified by an index into alternatePalette.
765     * @param layer 0 for background, 1 for lightness, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
766     * @param x in grid cells.
767     * @param y in grid cells.
768     * @param c char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
769     * @param alternatePalette an alternate Color List for both foreground and background
770     * @param colorIndex int[][] of indices into alternatePalette for the char being drawn
771     */
772    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char c, List<Color> alternatePalette,  int colorIndex)
773    {
774        SquidPanel p = backgroundPanel;
775        switch (layer)
776        {
777            case 0: break;
778            case 1: p = lightnessPanel;
779                break;
780            case 2: p = foregroundPanel;
781                break;
782            default: p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
783        }
784        if(alternatePalette == null) alternatePalette = palette;
785        p.put(x, y, c, colorIndex, alternatePalette);
786        values[x][y] = true;
787        return this;
788    }
789
790    /**
791     * Place a char c[][] into the specified layer, with a color specified by an index into alternatePalette.
792     * @param layer 0 for background, 1 for lightness, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
793     * @param x in grid cells.
794     * @param y in grid cells.
795     * @param c char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
796     */
797    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char[][] c)
798    {
799        SquidPanel p = backgroundPanel;
800        switch (layer)
801        {
802            case 0: break;
803            case 1: p = lightnessPanel;
804                break;
805            case 2: p = foregroundPanel;
806                break;
807            default: p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
808        }
809        p.put(x, y, c);
810        for(int i = x; i < c.length && i < width; i++)
811        {
812            for(int j = y; j < c[i].length && j < height; j++)
813            {
814                values[i][j] = true;
815            }
816        }
817        return this;
818    }
819
820    /**
821     * Place a char c[][] into the specified layer, with a color specified by an index into the default palette.
822     * @param layer 0 for background, 1 for lightness, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
823     * @param x in grid cells.
824     * @param y in grid cells.
825     * @param c char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
826     * @param colorIndex int[][] of indices into alternatePalette for the char being drawn
827     */
828    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char[][] c,  int[][] colorIndex)
829    {
830        SquidPanel p = backgroundPanel;
831        switch (layer)
832        {
833            case 0: break;
834            case 1: p = lightnessPanel;
835                break;
836            case 2: p = foregroundPanel;
837                break;
838            default: p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
839        }
840        p.put(x, y, c, colorIndex, palette);
841        for(int i = x; i < c.length && i < width; i++)
842        {
843            for(int j = y; j < c[i].length && j < height; j++)
844            {
845                values[i][j] = true;
846            }
847        }
848        return this;
849    }
850
851    /**
852     * Place a char c[][] into the specified layer, with a color specified by an index into alternatePalette.
853     * @param layer 0 for background, 1 for lightness, 2 for foreground, 3 or higher for extra layers added on.
854     * @param x in grid cells.
855     * @param y in grid cells.
856     * @param c char[][] to be drawn in the foreground starting from x, y
857     * @param alternatePalette an alternate Color List for both foreground and background
858     * @param colorIndex int[][] of indices into alternatePalette for the char being drawn
859     */
860    public SquidLayers putInto(int layer, int x, int y, char[][] c, List<Color> alternatePalette,  int[][] colorIndex)
861    {
862        SquidPanel p = backgroundPanel;
863        switch (layer)
864        {
865            case 0: break;
866            case 1: p = lightnessPanel;
867                break;
868            case 2: p = foregroundPanel;
869                break;
870            default: p = extraPanels.get(layer - 3);
871        }
872        if(alternatePalette == null) alternatePalette = palette;
873        p.put(x, y, c, colorIndex, alternatePalette);
874        for(int i = x; i < c.length && i < width; i++)
875        {
876            for(int j = y; j < c[i].length && j < height; j++)
877            {
878                values[i][j] = true;
879            }
880        }
881        return this;
882    }
883
884    /**
885     * Put a string at the given x, y position, using the default color.
886     * @param x in grid cells.
887     * @param y in grid cells.
888     * @param s the string to print
889     * @return this, for chaining
890     */
891    public SquidLayers putString(int x, int y, String s)
892    {
893        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s);
894        return this;
895    }
896    /**
897     * Put a string at the given x, y position, with the given index for foreground color that gets looked up in the
898     * default palette.
899     * @param x in grid cells.
900     * @param y in grid cells.
901     * @param s the string to print
902     * @param foregroundIndex
903     * @return this, for chaining
904     */
905    public SquidLayers putString(int x, int y, String s, int foregroundIndex)
906    {
907        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s, palette.get(foregroundIndex));
908        return this;
909    }
910    /**
911     * Put a string at the given x, y position, with the given indices for foreground and background color that look up
912     * their index in the default palette.
913     * @param x in grid cells.
914     * @param y in grid cells.
915     * @param s the string to print
916     * @param foregroundIndex
917     * @param backgroundIndex
918     * @return this, for chaining
919     */
920    public SquidLayers putString(int x, int y, String s, int foregroundIndex, int backgroundIndex)
921    {
922        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s, palette.get(foregroundIndex));
923        for(int i = x; i < s.length() && i < width; i++)
924        {
925            backgroundPanel.put(i, y, palette.get(backgroundIndex));
926        }
927        return this;
928    }
929
930    /**
931     * Put a string at the given x, y position, with the given indices for foreground and background color that look up
932     * their index in alternatePalette.
933     * @param x in grid cells.
934     * @param y in grid cells.
935     * @param s the string to print
936     * @param alternatePalette
937     * @param foregroundIndex
938     * @param backgroundIndex
939     * @return this, for chaining
940     */
941    public SquidLayers putString(int x, int y, String s, List<Color> alternatePalette, int foregroundIndex, int backgroundIndex)
942    {
943        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s, alternatePalette.get(foregroundIndex));
944        for(int i = x; i < s.length() && i < width; i++)
945        {
946            backgroundPanel.put(i, y, alternatePalette.get(backgroundIndex));
947        }
948        return this;
949    }
950
951    /**
952     * A utility method that draws a 1-cell-wide black box around the text you request (as s) and replaces the contents
953     * of anything that was below or adjacent to the string's new position. Useful for message boxes.
954     * @param x in grid cells.
955     * @param y in grid cells.
956     * @param s the string to print inside the box
957     * @return this, for chaining
958     */
959    public SquidLayers putBoxedString(int x, int y, String s)
960    {
961        if(y > 0 && y + 1 < height && x > 0 && x + 1 < width) {
962            for(int j = y - 1; j < y + 2 && j < height; j++) {
963                for (int i = x - 1; i < s.length() + x + 2 && i < width; i++) {
964                    foregroundPanel.put(i, j, ' ');
965                    backgroundPanel.put(i, j, palette.get(9));
966                    lightnesses[i][j] = -255;
967                    lightnessPanel.put(i, j, 1, lightingPalette);
968                }
969            }
970        }
971        foregroundPanel.put(x, y, s, palette.get(1));
972
973        return this;
974    }
975
976    /**
977     * Used to check if an x,y cell has changed, checking all layers for changes.
978     * @param x in grid cells.
979     * @param y in grid cells.
980     * @return true if it changed, false if it didn't.
981     */
982    public boolean hasChanged(int x, int y)
983    {
984        if(backgroundPanel.hasChanged(x, y) ||
985           lightnessPanel.hasChanged(x, y) ||
986           foregroundPanel.hasChanged(x, y)) return true;
987        for(int i = 0; i < extraPanels.size(); i++)
988        {
989            if(extraPanels.get(i).hasChanged(x, y)) return true;
990
991        }
992        return false;
993    }
994
995    /**
996     * Very basic check to see if something was rendered at the x,y cell requested. (usually this only checks the
997     * foreground) If blank, false, otherwise true.
998     * @param x in grid cells.
999     * @param y in grid cells.
1000     * @return
1001     */
1002    public boolean hasValue(int x, int y)
1003    {
1004        return values[x][y];
1005    }
1006
1007    /**
1008     * Clear one cell at position x, y of  its foreground contents.
1009     *
1010     * You may be looking for the erase() method, which erases all panels and all cells.
1011     *
1012     * @param x in grid cells
1013     * @param y in grid cells
1014     * @return
1015     */
1016    public SquidLayers clear(int x, int y)
1017    {
1018        foregroundPanel.clear(x, y);
1019        values[x][y] = false;
1020        return this;
1021    }
1022
1023    /**
1024     * Erase everything visible in all cells or all layers.  This can be expensive to do in a traditional game loop,
1025     * since Swing is not meant for that at all.
1026     * @return this, for chaining
1027     */
1028    public SquidLayers erase()
1029    {
1030        foregroundPanel.erase();
1031        lightnessPanel.erase();
1032        backgroundPanel.erase();
1033        for(SquidPanel sp : extraPanels)
1034        {
1035            sp.erase();
1036        }
1037        for(int i = 0; i < width; i++)
1038        {
1039            for(int j = 0; j < height; j++)
1040            {
1041                values[i][j] = false;
1042            }
1043        }
1044        return this;
1045    }
1046    @Override
1047    public void paintComponent(Graphics g) {
1048        super.paintComponent(g);
1049        paintComponents(g);
1050        Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().sync();
1051    }
1052
1053    /**
1054     * Call this whenever you want to show the changes you made to contents of this widget.
1055     */
1056    public void refresh()
1057    {
1058        backgroundPanel.refresh();
1059        lightnessPanel.refresh();
1060        foregroundPanel.refresh();
1061        for(SquidPanel sp : extraPanels)
1062        {
1063            sp.refresh();
1064        }
1065    }
1066
1067    private int clamp(int x, int min, int max)
1068    {
1069        return Math.min(Math.max(min, x), max);
1070    }
1071
1072}
